meanings.definition: A framework, typically consisting of rafters, posts, and struts, supporting a roof or bridge.
meanings.sent1: The trusses held up the roof of the barn.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers installed the trusses to support the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the trusses as monkey bars.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed under the trusses of the old bridge.
meanings.sent5: The trusses stood tall like giants, guarding the entrance to the castle.

meanings.definition: A surgical appliance used to support a hernia or an injured part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended wearing a truss after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: She felt relief when she put on the truss for her hernia.
meanings.sent3: The truss became her trusty sidekick, helping her move around.
meanings.sent4: The truss was like a gentle hug, supporting her weakened muscles.
meanings.sent5: With the truss on, she felt as strong as a superhero.

meanings.definition: A bundle of straw or hay.
meanings.sent1: The farmer carried a truss of hay to feed the animals.
meanings.sent2: She used a truss of straw to create a cozy bed for the kittens.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat nibbled on the truss of hay, leaving a mess behind.
meanings.sent4: The truss of straw was a soft cushion for the tired cat.
meanings.sent5: The truss of hay smelled like sunshine and fields, bringing back memories of childhood.
